definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: From the threshing floor? From the winepress?
And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那时，耶和华的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾场那里。

sentences.english: Withdraw your hand.' The angel of the Lord was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那时，耶和华的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾场那里。

sentences.english: Withdraw your hand. " The angel of the LORD was then standing at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
sentences.chinese: 那时，耶和华的使者站在耶布斯人阿珥楠的禾场那里。

sentences.english: And the floors shall be full of wheat, and the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
sentences.chinese: 禾场必满了麦子，酒榨与油榨必有新酒和油盈溢。

sentences.english: Supply him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor and your winepress.
sentences.chinese: 要从你羊群，禾场，酒榨之中多多地给他。

definition: to thresh or husk grain on a threshing ground (dialect)
to accumulate manure/to lay down compost
(dialect) maize/corn/also written 苞穀|苞谷[bao1 gu3]
to lay sth out to dry
